item.title: Superhero comedy Dispatch will launch on October 22nd
item.content:encoded:
AdHoc Studios has announced that its superhero comedy game Dispatch will release on October 22nd for PC and PS5, at least the first two episodes will. Dispatch will release episodically over four weeks with two episodes being dropped every week, meaning 8 episodes in total to dispatch your team of heroes to stop crime, and try to take down the Shroud and the Red Ring.

Starring Aaron Paul as a de-suited Robert Robertson, AKA Mecha Man, he has to adapt to life without powers, but still with a role to play. He joins the superhero dispatch center and ends up in charge of rehabilitating ex-supervillains back onto the straight and narrow. Also amongst the cast are Laura Bailey, Jeffrey Wright, Erin Yvette, Jacksepticeye, Moistcritical, Alanah Pearce, Travis Willingham, Matthew Mercer, Joel Haver, Lance Cantstopolis, and Thot Squad. There will be segments where you manage sending out heroes to answer calls for help, as well as juggling the roster of heroes that you have, managing their particular skills and abilities as they unlock, but thereâ€™s also plenty of other points where you delve into office relationships and chat to people.

If you are interested in the game, you can download the Dispatch demo on Steam.

Source: YouTube



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/09/16/superhero-comedy-dispatch-will-launch-on-october-22nd/

item.title: Splinter Cell: Deathwatch will release on October 14th
item.content:encoded:
Ubisoft and Netflix have confirmed the release date of the Splinter Cell animated series Splinter Cell: Deathwatch, stating it will be available to watch from October 14th. To mark the release date, a trailer has been released showing an aged Sam Fisher coming back to deal with a new threat to the world, and one that has origins in his own past.

Derek Kolstad, best known for writing the John Wick series, has penned the story with Liev Screiber voicing Sam Fisher. Kirby Howell-Baptiste is voicing new agent Zinnia McKenna, Janet Varney is voicing Anna Grimsdottir, and Joel Ouelette is Thunder. The story looks to be about a watch that contains a secret people are dying to find out about. Splinter Cell: Deathwatch has taken a while to hit our screens, with the show first announced back in 2020. A year later, Ubisoft announced the Splinter Cell Remake was in development , but there has been no significant update since.

Source: YouTube



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/09/16/splinter-cell-deathwatch-will-release-on-october-14th/
